channel.title: Help with compiling
channel.description:
i recently started learning the use of c++ and java. Although i may not be extensive in these languages, i have the determination to do so. In my recent coding projects, i discovered moparscape on google. To my dismay, it was simplae at first. Then i began looking up details on compiling at the java site..i set some environmental variables although i am not sure they are correct or not. I began to make a compiler. I am pretty sure it works, but i could be wrong. Anyways the coding i used for my compiler is this:
[code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe" ./files/*.java pause[/code]
I believe it works becuz i tested it...it seems like it would work, but i think something is wrong.
Everytime i use it when compiling my runescape files i come across an error which i hate!!!!!!
it says:
Note: some input files are unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: recompile with -xlint:unchecked for details. Press any key to continue.
1. After seeing this message i keep thinking to my self and i wonder if maybe i put the compiler in the wrong place 2. Maybe i wrote the code wrong... 3. Did i do the environment variables right?
I searched gogle frantically but nothing seemed to help, so i have officially decided to post at the mother of all project sites(in which has me hooked :D) asking this simple question.
What is wrong?
should the compiler say echo on and at the bottom echo off instead of pause?
i just want some straight answers, im accepting all answers as i will try them all, please dont post that i am a noob, or that im "leeching" as people seem to do here alot i have noticed...im here to learn, not fight

item.title: Help with compiling
item.dc:creator: @negative101 negative101
item.description:
@negative101 wrote:

that long explination to say u made a compiler that a lot of people have and u thought it was wrong
LOL

Read full topic

item.title: Help with compiling
item.dc:creator: @trivenge trivenge
item.description:
@trivenge wrote:

so the message i received simply means that they are already compiled? if so then WOW boy i feel lame rofl

Read full topic

item.title: Help with compiling
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

There is no problem. Your files were successfully compiled.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with compiling
item.dc:creator: @trivenge trivenge
item.description:
@trivenge wrote:

xx qwertyuiop xx:

Don’t worry about that, it isn’t an error.

If my compiler isnt an error, then can u direct me in the right direction?

Could it be my environment variables? Sumthing wrong with the classpath and path variables?

Maybe it could be that i put the compiler in the wrong spot? i think its in the right spot…i think

Read full topic

item.title: Help with compiling
item.dc:creator: @trivenge trivenge
item.description:
@trivenge wrote:

i recently started learning the use of c++ and java. Although i may not be extensive in these languages, i have the determination to do so. In my recent coding projects, i discovered moparscape on google. To my dismay, it was simplae at first. Then i began looking up details on compiling at the java site…i set some environmental variables although i am not sure they are correct or not. I began to make a compiler. I am pretty sure it works, but i could be wrong. Anyways the coding i used for my compiler is this:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe" ./files/*.java pause

I believe it works becuz i tested it…it seems like it would work, but i think something is wrong.

Everytime i use it when compiling my runescape files i come across an error which i hate!!!

it says:

Note: some input files are unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: recompile with -xlint:unchecked for details.
Press any key to continue.

  1. After seeing this message i keep thinking to my self and i wonder if maybe i put the compiler in the wrong place
  2. Maybe i wrote the code wrong…
  3. Did i do the environment variables right?

I searched gogle frantically but nothing seemed to help, so i have officially decided to post at the mother of all project sites(in which has me hooked :D) asking this simple question.

What is wrong?

should the compiler say echo on and at the bottom echo off instead of pause?

i just want some straight answers, im accepting all answers as i will try them all, please dont post that i am a noob, or that im “leeching” as people seem to do here alot i have noticed…im here to learn, not fight
